details.content:
Earlier, in a late Tuesday night development even as counting of votes was underway in various districts, the MP Congress chief Kamal Nath had sent a letter to the Governor Anandiben Patel, seeking appointment to stake claim for government formation. 

अंतिम निर्णय के पश्चात, @INCIndia के वरिष्ठ नेताओं के साथ मध्यप्रदेश की माननीय राज्यपाल @GovernorMP आनंदीबन पटेल जी से मुलाक़ात कर सरकार बनाने का दावा पेश करेंगे। pic.twitter.com/Q9c0FaFlx9

— Jyotiraditya Scindia (@JM_Scindia) December 11, 2018

All results for 230 seats were declared by early Wednesday morning. The Congress has emerged as single largest party with 114 seats, followed by BJP with 109 seats, four independents, two seats for BSP and one seat for SP.

According to top Congress sources, the Raj Bhawan had responded to Nath's letter positively saying that Congress will definitely be given appointment once the Election Commission renders final results to the Governor.

details.title: Will support Congress to 'keep BJP out': Mayawati
details.content:
Mayawati: Even though we don't agree with many of Congress's policies we have agreed to support them in Madhya Pradesh and if need be in Rajasthan #AssemblyElections2018 pic.twitter.com/1EDRUwyNuU

— ANI (@ANI) December 12, 2018

details.title: Won't stake claim to form government in MP: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
details.content: CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan says BJP won't stake claim to form government. Since the party hasn't got adequate number of seats despite having slightly greater share of votes than Congress, it won't try to form the government.

Bhopal: Shivraj Singh Chouhan arrives at Raj Bhawan to tender his resignation to the Governor. #MadhyaPradeshElections2018 pic.twitter.com/8j1HXEs6P0

— ANI (@ANI) December 12, 2018
Samajwadi Party will support Congress in forming the government in Madhya Pradesh. (ANI)
Outgoing CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan hands over resignation to governor Anandiben Patel. Congratulates Kamal Nath. "I m free now," says Chouhan.
State Congress campaign committee chief Jyotiraditya Scindia response to BJP and Shivraj Singh Chouhan "Maaf kijiye Shivraj, ab aayaa Janta ka raaj."

His response to BJP's failed slogan in MP "Abki Baar 200 paar" is even if total seats of all five states is taken into account BJP has failed to get 200 seats. BJP should shed arrogance and come to ground realities, said Scindia.

details.title: Scindia leaves the decision to Congress High Command
details.content: When asked if he is in CM's race, Scindia says "the decision of party high command will be supreme."

Shobha Oza, Congress: At 1 PM Kamal Nath will meet former CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan as a courtesy visit. At 4 PM we have a meeting of party MLAs & AK Antony is coming as observer and after it we will put in a word with Rahul Ji. #MadhyaPradesh pic.twitter.com/8CckNTvKcw

— ANI (@ANI) December 12, 2018
Kamal Nath and other Congress leaders reach Raj Bhawan to stake claim for forming next government.

Speaking to the media, Kamal Nath said, "Every section of MP has voted for the Congress, we'll live up to their expectations.
Will meet our friend Shivraj Singh Chouhan and greet him for giving a commendable fight in the assembly polls."

details.title: Rajasthan assembly election results
details.content:
#RajasthanElections2018 | Congress was not able to cross the majority mark as Sachin Pilot did not give tickets to the right candidates, says rebel MLA Ramkesh Meena from Rajasthan. @asnaniraajesh pic.twitter.com/11aps4RYMy

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) December 12, 2018

Meanwhile, in Rajashthan, rebel MLA from Gangapur City Ramkesh Meena tells TNIE that Ashok Gehlot has their full support.
Kamal Nath likely to meet outgoing CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan at 1 PM.

details.title: MP ka CM kaisa ho, Jyotiraditya Scindia jaisa ho!
details.content:
While senior Congress leaders are meeting Governor Anandiben Patel inside the Raj Bhawan, party workers are drumming up support to make Jyotiraditya Scindia as the chief minister.

Carrying party flags and pictures of Scindia, his supporters are shouting, "MP ka CM kaisa ho, Jyotiraditya Scindia jaisa ho."
Kamal Nath hands over to Governor Anandiben Patel the list of 121 newly elected MLAs (114 Congress, four independents, two BSP and one SP MLA).

Sharad Pawar, NCP: Congress has played an important role in giving alternative to BJP. Congress was receptive towards other small parties. BSP and SP should be a part of our alliance. They aren't yet together with us. People have expressed displeasure on 4.5 years of BJP rule.

Former Congress president Sonia Gandhi on Wednesday described the party's good showing in the assembly poll in three Hindi heartland states as a victory over the BJP's "negative politics".

Gandhi's reaction came after the Congress ousted BJP governments in Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh and Madhya Pradesh.

Expressing happiness over the polls outcome, the UPA chairperson said it was a "Congress victory over the BJP's negative politics".

A resurgent Congress Tuesday made significant gains in the Assembly elections, dealing a body blow to the BJP in Chhattisgarh and Rajasthan, while emerging as the single largest party in Madhya Pradesh.

(PTI)

Narendra Saluja, Congress after meeting MP Governor: We have met Governor and staked claim to form Govt, we have the support of 122 MLAs, the situation is clear #MadhyaPradeshElections2018 pic.twitter.com/6aLgFSLmR9

— ANI (@ANI) December 12, 2018
Congress stakes claim to form govt in MP after meeting Governor Anandiben Patel. (Photo | Special arrangement)

I welcome #TRS chief #KCR proposal to interfere in #AP politics; #Kapu partriach #MudragadaPadmanabham @NewIndianXpress

— Phareesh_TNIE (@Phareesh_tnie) December 12, 2018

#MadhyaPradeshElections2018 में आपने @BJP4MP को सबसे अधिक वोट दिया, आप सभी का ह्रदय से आभार व्यक्त करता हूं। समाज के हर वर्ग के साथ मध्यप्रदेश के सर्वांगीण विकास हेतु अपना आशीर्वाद हमारे प्रत्याशियों को देने के लिए राज्य के समस्त नागरिकों का धन्यवाद।

— ShivrajSingh Chouhan (@ChouhanShivraj) December 12, 2018

details.title: Congress leaders meeting in Rajasthan underway
details.content:
The Congress legislature party has passed a to officiate party high command to decide on the name of the next chief minister.
Former Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot and State Congress president Sachin Pilot are the frontrunners for the CM post.

Congratulations to the Congress & especially to its leader @RahulGandhi for the great success in these elections. He took the blame & the brickbats for all the set backs & now deserves the credit for these victories. It was nice to have something to celebrate on counting day.
Rajat Kumar, CEO, Telangana met Telangana Governor ESL Narasimhan at Raj Bhavan on Wednesday and handed over the list of elected representatives of the State Legislative Assembly.

<iframe width="100%" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/e9ExQkuVHEg" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Rajasthan Advocate General Narpat Mal Lodha resigned from the post Wednesday after the BJP lost the assembly elections in the state, officials said. Lodha handed over his resignation to Governor Kalyan Singh, a Raj Bhawan spokesperson said.

(PTI)

TRS president K Chandrasekhar Rao was Wednesday elected leader of the legislature party, paving the way for his return as Chief Minister for the second straight term. The newly-elected MLAs met at Telangana Bhavan, the TRS headquarters here, and took the decision unanimously, the party sources said.

(PTI)

Outgoing CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan takes entire responsibility of poll debacle in MP. "It's my failure that we couldn't convey the right message to people. I hope Congress president Rahul Gandhi meets the deadline of farm loan waiver promise made in MP. Now it's our turn to play the chowkidar.
On possibility of shifting to national politics, Chouhan says "Meri aatma MP mein basti hai (my soul belongs to MP)."

Congress leaders Kamal Nath and Jyotiraditya Scindia received Observer AK Antony at the Bhopal Airport in Madhya Pradesh. The party MLAs' meeting begins at 4 PM today. pic.twitter.com/zFnQcfyBOg

— ANI (@ANI) December 12, 2018
Kamal Nath and Jyotiraditya Scindia wave at the crowd at Congress office in Bhopal where they are participating in the Congress Legislature Party (CLP) meeting.

details.title: What's your take chachaji, asks Tejashwi Yadav to Nitish Kumar
details.content:
बिहार के मुख्यमंत्री नीतीश कुमार ने पलटी मारने के तुरंत बाद कहा था,”मोदी जी का मुकाबला करने की क्षमता इस देश में किसी में नहीं है”

मैं विनम्रता से नीतीश जी से पूछना चाहता हूँ, अब इस बारे में उनका क्या विचार है? अंतरात्मा से बात कर पलटी मारने की सोच रहे है ना? है ना चाचा जी?

— Tejashwi Yadav (@yadavtejashwi) December 12, 2018

Members of the TRS Legislature Party met Telangana Governor E S L Narasimhan at Raj Bhavan on Wednesday and submitted letter on the unanimous election of K Chandrashekar Rao as Leader of the TRS Legislature Party.

@ncbn reacts to #KCR comments on #ReturnGift: In a democracy, any leader can visit any state and do what they want (politics), @ncbn says @NewIndianXpress

— Phareesh_TNIE (@Phareesh_tnie) December 12, 2018
Telangana CEO Rajat Kumar met with governor ESL Narasimhan with the list of elected representatives of TS Legislative Assembly.
KCR and his cabinet will take the oath of office at 1.30 pm at Raj Bhawan on Thursday.

details.title: Traffic advisory issued in view of KCR's swearing-in ceremony

details.content:
Shobha Oza, Congress in Bhopal: All the MLAs have unanimously decided that a decision on the Chief Minister (of Madhya Pradesh) will be taken by Rahul Gandhi ji. pic.twitter.com/tdW8iVxpRR

— ANI (@ANI) December 12, 2018

details.title: Madhya Pradesh: Elected MLAs resolve that Congress president will decide state leader
details.content: Senior most MLA Arif Aqeel moved the resolution for electing the leader at the meeting attended by all Cong MLAs and four independent MLAs (the Congress rebels) in presence of two AICC observers AK Antony and Bhanwar Jitendra Singh. Subsequently, the elected MLAs unanimously resolved that the Congress president will decide who will be the leader in MP.

details.title: Decision on Madhya Pradesh CM likely on Thursday
details.content: Two AICC observers are meeting MLAs individually to know their choice after which they will fly back to Delhi and brief about the developments to Rahul Gandhi. The final call will be taken by Rahul on Thursday morning.

Rajasthan: Ashok Gehlot, Sachin Pilot and other Congress leaders arrive at the Governor's House in Jaipur. pic.twitter.com/q6HnTqqh9N

— ANI (@ANI) December 12, 2018

details.title: Rajasthan: Rahul Gandhi to decide on state CM
details.content: Rajasthan Congress leaders have left the decision of selection the leader of the elected legislature to Party president Rahul Gandhi.

details.title: Zoramthanga to take oath as Mizoram CM on Saturday
details.content: Mizo National Front (MNF) chief Zoramthanga will take oath as the chief minister of Mizoram for the third time in 20 years on Saturday.
Zoramthanga, who is a former rebel leader-turned-politician, had served as Mizoram CM for two terms from 1998-2008. This election, his MNF had swept the polls winning 26 of the 40 seats. (ALSO READ)

Chhattisgarh: Newly elected Congress MLA from Raipur, Kuldeep Singh Juneja, arrives for Congress Legislature Party (CLP) meeting on a scooty. pic.twitter.com/KX9LWp7k6F

— ANI (@ANI) December 12, 2018
A 5-member delegation of Congress party, including Kamal Nath, Jyotiraditya Scindia and Digvijaya Singh, met Governor Anandiben Patel today to stake their claim to form government in MadhyaPradesh.

AICC observers for Rajasthan KC Venugopal, General Secretary Avinash Pandey and Secretary Incharges will reach Delhi tonight and meet Congress President Rahul Gandhi at his residence tomorrow at 10 am.

It's a normal procedure for Congress party legislators to give their feedback to observers. Observers give feedback to Congress President and then a final decision is taken. We have authorised Congress President to take a final view as to who will head CLP leaders of the party: Sachin Pilot

M Kharge, Observer for Chhattisgarh: It has been unanimously decided that the head of the CLP leaders will be decided by Rahul Gandhi. Rahul Gandhi had said that even if a resolution is passed unanimously, every MLA should be talked to & their opinions have to be considered. pic.twitter.com/93z80vLNU7

— ANI (@ANI) December 12, 2018
